alert.note: Alert for West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 10 at 1:43PM MST until March 11 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW POSSIBLE IN THE HIGH COUNTRY FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY... .A storm system is expected to bring heavy snow to the north central mountains of Colorado starting late this morning and continue through Saturday afternoon, heaviest tonight. The heaviest snowfall is expected to occur in the Park and Gore Ranges, the I-70 corridor will also be affected but with lesser amounts. The combination of heavy snow and gusty winds will cause poor visibility and difficult travel conditions. Weekend mountain travel will be impacted with icy and snowpacked roads. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations between 10 and 20 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass. * WHEN...Until 5 PM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.

area.areaDesc: West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet
